meanings.definition: to close or fasten with stitches
meanings.sent1: She carefully steeks the fabric together to make a dress.
meanings.sent2: Mom steeks the buttons on my shirt to keep it from falling off.
meanings.sent3: The tailor steeks the torn cloth back together, good as new.
meanings.sent4: His determination steeks his resolve to succeed in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between them steeks their bond forever.

meanings.definition: a line of stitches used to secure a garment opening
meanings.sent1: The dressmaker added steeks to the sides of the dress for easy wearing.
meanings.sent2: The steeks on the jacket kept the zipper in place.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the yarn, unraveling the steeks on the sweater.
meanings.sent4: The steeks on the bag held all her belongings safe and sound.
meanings.sent5: The colorful steeks on the quilt added a touch of beauty to the design.

meanings.definition: having a stitched closure or seam
meanings.sent1: The steeks edges of the pillowcase looked neat and tidy.
meanings.sent2: The steeks hem on the skirt kept it from fraying.
meanings.sent3: The steeks pattern on the blanket made it unique and special.
meanings.sent4: Her steeks sweater kept her warm in the chilly weather.
meanings.sent5: The steeks seam on the bag ensured it was durable and strong.
